intro: Rhodalsine geniculata var. fontqueri, commonly known as the Fontqueri's rhodalsine, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of California. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers and wet winters. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, providing a drought-resistant feature. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive species requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
